chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
B: poset
x: A -> B

Goal:
fun_leq x x

Premises:
fun_leq = fun p1 p2 : A -> B => forall x : A, p1 x <== p2 x : (A -> B) -> (A -> B) -> Prop Arguments fun_leq (_ _)%function_scope
Notation poset := Poset.type
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
Relation_Operators.clos_trans_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> P x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x a -> P x a
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_trans _%type_scope
pair_asym : forall (A B : poset) (x y : A * B), pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y x -> x = y
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
pair_trans : forall (A B : poset) (x y z : A * B), pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y z -> pair_leq x z
pair_leq : forall A B : poset, A * B -> A * B -> Prop
Setoid.Setoid_Theory : forall A : Type, Relation_Definitions.relation A -> Prop
pred = fun T : Type => T -> bool : Type -> Type Arguments pred _%type_scope
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop; _ : forall x : T, mx_leq x x; _ : forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y; _ : forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z } Arguments Poset.mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments Poset.Mixin [T]%type_scope [mx_leq]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
pair_refl : forall (A B : poset) (x : A * B), pair_leq x x
pairPoset = fun A B : poset => Poset.Pack {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |} (A * B) : poset -> poset -> poset
Poset.Pack : forall sort : Type, Poset.class_of sort -> Type -> poset
pred_sort : forall T : Type, predType T -> Type
cat = fun T : Type => fix cat (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => x :: cat s1' s2 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Arguments cat {T}%type_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g
poset_asym : forall (T : poset) (x y : T), x <== y -> y <== x -> x = y
poset_trans : forall (T : poset) (y x z : T), x <== y -> y <== z -> x <== z
Variant Mem_Pred (T : Type) : Type := MemProp : Pred T -> Mem_Pred T Arguments Mem_Pred _%type_scope Arguments MemProp [T]%type_scope
Equality.sort = fun t : eqType => let (sort, _) := t in sort : eqType -> Type Equality.sort is a coercion
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
ARmul_1_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul x rI) x
Poset.sort = fun t : poset => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : poset -> Type Poset.sort is a coercion
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | PX : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C Arguments Ring_polynom.Pol _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pinj [C]%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PX [C]%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
sub_asym : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y x -> x = y
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
pairPosetMixin : forall A B : poset, Poset.mixin_of (A * B)
Record predType (T : Type) : Type := PredType { pred_sort : Type; topred : pred_sort -> pred T } Arguments predType _%type_scope Arguments ssr.ssrbool.PredType [T pred_sort]%type_scope _%function_scope
Record type : Type := Pack { sort : Type; _ : Poset.class_of sort; _ : Type } Arguments Poset.Pack [sort]%type_scope _ _%type_scope
sub_leq : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T), {x : T | x \In s} -> {x : T | x \In s} -> Prop
BinInt.Z.divide = fun x y : BinNums.Z => exists z : BinNums.Z, y = BinInt.Z.mul z x : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
ARmul_1_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x
